name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's loss, @noUpside writes, "has precipitated a deep rift in the right-wing information ecosystem." Media outlets, tech platforms, and commentators have had to choose between upholding reality and pretending that the president really won. https://t.co/f6lIvR3nAC

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose parents have forbidden him from telling his younger brother that he's gay. https://t.co/YW4zD9FmyP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The question is not whether Trump can pardon himself. It’s whether he can grant himself a pardon," writes @elmunc: https://t.co/bkXSU2rB7c

name: TheAtlantic
text: Netflix’s "Hillbilly Elegy" is an Oscar-friendly narrative of personal triumph in the face of great hardship, a movie designed to end with an uplifting epigraph; it is also one of the worst movies of the year, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/096gTcX7rs

name: TheAtlantic
text: Building a new administration in the span of 11 weeks is a tall order in normal times. But Joe Biden has the added challenge of doing almost all of it virtually, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/x40LrDcwHF

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The Ghost of Christmas Past has much to tell us about what we should expect this year,” @amandamull writes: “Shopping isn’t going anywhere.” https://t.co/SA6ydfoUj6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I see the opportunists and abettors reveling in their transgressions of norms, embracing the chaos, and relishing their own moment in the sun," writes Edward S. Steinfeld of @WatsonInstitute. "Oh, how tantalizing it is to play with fire." https://t.co/aXFcH1dzVO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Both Barack Obama's recent memoir and The Crown's depiction of Margaret Thatcher are exercises in mythology, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/6lIlgUnLj0

name: TheAtlantic
text: If you insist on having a Thanksgiving gathering this year, here's how to reduce the risk, writes @jameshamblin: https://t.co/pXjIsq96Ys

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As a census taker, I got a front-porch view of what happens when a 230-year-old national rite runs headlong into a country all but at war with itself and its institutions," @AllMyChandler writes. https://t.co/Y8RNulGSzv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Both the president and members of Congress take an oath to uphold the Constitution. President Trump is violating his oath. Congressional Republicans who hesitate to speak this truth fall short of theirs," @greggnunziata writes: https://t.co/thQi3xBQQZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Experts are predicting a significant drop-off in births in the U.S. next year. @jpinsk reports on its possible size and consequences: https://t.co/fObFzCheXB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: Read @AllMyChandler on what it was like to be a census taker this year--and all the scary ways this essential democratic process failed. 
https://t.co/Ok50WjO3fN

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: Black Friday draws ever nearer, but Black Friday is already all around us. I wrote about the Ghost of Christmas Shopping Past and what it has to tell us about the next month of the American pandemic. https://t.co/GpwuQX3YnY

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "The liberty that Macron so vigorously defends, and for which France has sacrificed so much, is being legislated away, bequeathing to a future, more authoritarian leader a powerful set of antidemocratic tools," @mirakamdar writes: https://t.co/elHhFDWToH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @denisewills: "There’s a lot in Rudolph that people don’t seem to remember. At one point, the Abominable Snowmonster tries to murder Rudolph in front of his parents by smashing a giant stalactite on his head." 

Don't miss this @CaitlinPacific treat. https://t.co/Eify78aIKZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: This is so original and smart. Props to @ibogost! 

https://t.co/OHSeGHqqmX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "One of the numerous readings of the show is that it is a parable about the hardship faced by gay kids in mid-century America, many of whom were rejected by their fathers, their peers, and their teachers."
From @CaitlinPacific:
https://t.co/ER5mTT6xNk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlanticPR: News: @TheAtlantic  and @WNYCStudios are announcing a partnership on a new podcast, hosted by @hooliwho. "The Experiment: stories from an unfinished country" will launch in early 2021. https://t.co/7lPHsdSPC6
